Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. The number of people with the flu during an epidemic is a function, \(f\), of the number of days, \(d\), since the epidemic began. The equation \(f(d)=50 \cdot (\frac{3}{2})^d\) defines \(f\).

    1. How many people had the flu at the beginning of the epidemic? Do not enter commas or spaces in your answer.

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.9.2.

The correct answer is 50 because \(f(0)=50\).

    1. What does \(f(1)\) mean in this situation?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activity 5.9.2.

The correct answer is: The number of people infected 1 day after the epidemic began.

  1. The function, \(f\), gives the dollar value of a bond \(t\) years after the bond was purchased. The graph of \(f\) is shown.

    1. What is \(f(0)\)? Do not enter commas or spaces in your answer.

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 5.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 1000.

    1. When is \(f(t)=1500\)? Estimate the nearest whole number. Do not enter commas or spaces in your answer.

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 5.9.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 8.

  1. A function \(f\) gives the number of stray cats in a town \(t\) years since the town started an animal control program. The program includes both sterilizing stray cats and finding homes to adopt them. An equation representing \(f\) is \(f(t)=243{(\frac13)}^t\).

    1. What is the value of \(f(t)\) when \(t\) is 0?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activities 5.9.2–5.9.3.

The correct answer is 243.

    1. What is the value of \(f(t)\) when \(t\) is 1?

Correct!

Try again. Revisit activities 5.9.2–5.9.3.

The correct answer is 81.

  1. Function \(g\) gives the amount of a chemical in a person’s body, in milligrams, \(t\) hours since the patient took the drug. The equation \(g(t)=600\cdot (\frac35)^t\) defines this function.

    1. Which is the best choice for the domain of \(g\)?

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 5.9.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(t\geq0\).

    1. Which is the best choice for the range of \(g\)?

Correct!

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 5.9.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(0 < g \leq 600\).
